newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia landslide rescuers find no more alive.
newsitem.headline: Australia landslide rescuers find no more alive.

text.p: Rescuers early on Thursday recovered the body of the last known victim in a landslide that claimed 18 lives last week at this popular Snowy Mountain ski village
There was only one survivor, ski instructor Stuart Diver, 27, who was pulled last Saturday night from the rubble of the collapsed mountainside at Thredbo, south of Canberra.
Rescuers recovered the 18th dead body early on Thursday, the eighth freezing night of the search, after a week spent digging through the wreckage of two lodges destroyed in the landslide.
"We have accounted for all 19 people," ambulance spokesman Brian Parcell said after the final victim's body was pulled from the debris in rain at 2 a.m. (1600 GMT Wednesday).
The steep slope gave way around midnight on July 30, sending one lodge crashing into another below it, engulfing their 19 occupants in a cascade of concrete, twisted metal, trees and dirt.
Police have not yet identified all the victims.
